name: Mirror Master Data
description: Module migrates the intersect of fields found in parent and child project

project-settings.name: List of Child Projects to receive Mirrored Data

sub_settings.name:
SELECT TRIGGERING FORM
Only clone if this form is saved. If left blank, any save in the project will trigger a clone.

If longitudinal, enter the source event name.
Make sure to enter the corresponding TARGET event name below.

SPECIFY TRIGGERING LOGIC
Only clone if this logical expression is true (leave blank for always clone)

SPECIFY EVENT NAME OF TARGET FORM
Leave blank if classical

SELECT FIELDS TO MIGRATE
Fields in both parent and target have to match (fieldname has to exist in both projects.)
Select the inclusion criteria.

choices.name: Migrate all intersection of fieldnames (with optional exclusions)
Migrate these specified fieldnames only (of intersect of fieldnames)

sub_settings.name:
Excluded fields
List of fields to exclude from copying to child project(s)

Include only fields
List of fields to include - if specified ONLY these fields will be copied to the child project(s)

Migrate only fields from this CHILD form
Intersection of fields from child and parent will only include child fields from this form.

Migrate only fields from this PARENT form
Intersection of fields from child and parent will only include parent fields from this form.

REDO MIGRATION / CLOBBER EXISTING DATA
If this is checked, then the migration will be repeated.

This can result in multiple records being created if new ID creation is set or existing data in the target project to be overwritten if TARGET ID is reused.

SELECT HOW TARGET ID SHOULD BE CREATED:
State of Clobber existing data will determine whether migration will overwrite existing data.

choices.name: Use value entered in PARENT field
Create a new ID in TARGET project

sub_settings.name:
CHILD ID Version 2: ID to be used specified in parent
If this field is populated, this ID will be used in the migration attempt. Use this field if you need to specify your child ID, rather than have one created.
If there is no entry, then there will not be a migration.
The value entered for Clobber existing data will determine whether migration will overwrite existing data.

CHILD ID Version 3.a: Create new ID:
prefix
If this field is specified, then the child ID will be prefixed.

CHILD ID Version 3.c: Create new ID:
padding
If this field is specified, then the unique ID of the child ID will be padded with zeros to this number of characters. For example, a padding of 4 will result in an id:STAN-0004

LOGGING IN TARGET: Parent ID
If specified, then the parent ID will be logged here.

LOGGING IN PARENT: Child ID
If specified, then the child ID will be logged here.

LOGGING IN PARENT: Migration Timestamp in Parent Project
Upon completion of migration, timestamp will be logged in this field.
An existing entry here will prevent repeat migration unless Clobber existing data is checked.

LOGGING IN PARENT: Migration NOTES in Parent Project
Upon completion of migration, notes will be logged in this field.
